summary: The "Enhancing the Transitioning Servicemember’s Experience Act" (ETS Act) amends titles 10 and 38 of the United States Code to improve programs for service members nearing separation or veterans, focusing on the Transition Assistance Program (TAP). Key provisions include expanded pre-separation counseling, pilot programs for military spouses, improved coordination between the Departments of Defense, Veterans Affairs, and Labor, and audits of pre-separation counseling. The bill also extends transitional healthcare, provides a GAO study of the SkillBridge program, and expands eligibility for job counseling, training, and placement services.
